intro: Geniostoma celastrineum, commonly known as the red spider lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant produces small, dark red berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Geniostoma celastrineum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
